_88MetaType.description: CMR level metadata about the item found. This represents data not found in the actual metadata.

___native-id.description: The id used by the provider to identify this item during ingest.

___provider-id.description: The identity of the provider in the CMR

___format.description: The mime type of the original metadata

___revision-id.description: A number >= 1 that indicates which revision of the item.

___deleted.description: Indicates if the item represents a tombstone

___user-id.description: The id of the user who created this item revision.

___revision-date.description: The date this revision was created. This would be the creation or update date of the item in the CMR.

___concept-id.description: The concept id of the item found.

___revision-id.description: A number >= 1 that indicates which revision of the item.

___concept-id.description: The concept id of the item found.

_88ItemType.description: Represents a single item found in search results. It contains some metadata about the item found along with the UMM representing the item. umm won't be present if the item represents a tombstone.

_88FillValueType.description: The fill value, fill value type and fill value description  of the variable in the data file. The fill value is generally a value which falls outside the valid range. For example, if the valid range is '0, 360', the fill value may be '-1'. The fill value type is data provider-defined. For example, 'Out of Valid Range'.

___Description.description: Description of the fill value of the variable in the data file.

___Type.description: Type of the fill value of the variable in the data file.

___Value.description: The fill value of the variable in the data file.

_88DimensionType.description: A variable consists of one or more dimensions. An example of a dimension name is 'XDim'. An example of a dimension size is '1200'. Variables are rarely one dimensional.

___Name.description: The name of the dimension of the variable represented in the data field. For example, 'XDim.

___Size.description: The size of the dimension of the variable represented in the data field. For example, '1200'.

_88ValidRangeType.description: Valid range data value of a variable: minimum and maximum values. For example, '-100, 5000'.

___Min.description: Minimum data value of a variable. For example, '-100'.

___Max.description: Maximum data value of a variable. For example, '5000'.

_88SetType.description: The elements of this section apply to variable sets.

___Name.description: This element enables specification of set name. For example, 'Data_Fields'.

___Type.description: This element enables specification of set type. For example, if the variables have been grouped together based on a particular theme, such as wavelength, then the type should be set to that theme, otherwise it should be set to 'General'.

___Index.description: This element specifies the index value within the set for this variable, For example, if this varible is the third variable in the set, the index value should be set to '3'.

___Size.description: This element specifies the number of variables in the set. For example, if the number of variables in the set is fifteen, the size should be set to '15'.

_88VariableTypeEnum.description: This element is used to identify the variable as a Science Variable or as a Quality Variable or as an Ancillary Variable. If a variable does not contain this field, it will be assumed to be a science variable.

_88MeasurementsType.description: The elements of this section apply to a measurement.

___MeasurementName.description: This element allows authors to provide community sourced words or phrases to further describe the variable data.

___MeasurementSource.description: This element allows authors to identify the source of the measurements.

_88ServiceTypeEnum.description: This element enables specification of service type.

_88ServiceType.description: The elements of this section apply to a variable.

___ServiceTypes.description: The service types available for the variable. For example, 'WMS, WCS'.

___Visualizable.description: A flag to indicate whether this variable is able to be visualized within the context of a service.

___Subsettable.description: A flag to indicate whether this variable is able to be subsetted within the context of a service.

_88CharacteristicsType.description: The elements of this section apply to a variable.

___ReportingConditions.description: The reporting conditions of the variable. The conditions over which the measurement of the variable are valid. For example, 'STP: 1013 mb and 273 K'.

___Bounds.description: Describes the spatial bounds of a variable. Western Longitude, Northern Latitude and Eastern Longitude, Southern Latitude - often specified in decimal degrees. For example, 'UpperLeftPointMtrs = -180.0, 89.5; LowerRightMtrs = 177.5, -89.5.'

___SizeUnits.description: The computed byte size units for the variable, per the data field. For example B, KB, MB, GB.

___Reference.description: Provides a link to variable's reference documentation.

___MeasurementConditions.description: The measurement conditions of the variable. For example, 'Sampled Particle Size Range: 90 - 600 nm'.

___ChunkSize.description: Describes the chunk size of a variable. For example, '100'.

___StandardName.description: The CF-compliant 'Standard Name' for the variable.

___Coordinates.description: A text description of the variable’s coordinate range as given by the data provider. For example, '90N, 90S, 180E, 180W'.

___Size.description: The computed byte size for the variable, per the data field. Typically, this is the X dimension times the Y dimension times the number of bytes in the data type (8, 16, 32, etc.). For example, 1200 x 1200 x 16 = 23,040,000.

___GridMapping.description: A text description of the variable's mapping projection standard for the variable. For example: 'WGS84 Web Mercator'.

___Structure.description: The full path to the variable within the Granule. For example, '/<filename>/MODIS_Grid_Daily_1km_LST/Data_Fields/', where filename = 'MOD11A1.A2009172.h16v05.006.2016014073638.hdf'.

_88DataTypeEnum.description: This element is used to identify the data type of the variable.

___DataType.description: Specify data type of a variable. These types can be either: uint8, uint16, etc.

___Dimensions.description: A variable consists of one or more dimensions. An example of a dimension name is 'XDim'. An example of a dimension size is '1200'. Variables are rarely one dimensional.

___Characteristics.description: The characteristics of a variable.  The elements of this section apply to a Variable.

___Units.description: The units associated with a variable.

___Services.description: The service information of a variable.

___LongName.description: The expanded or long name related to the variable Name.

___ScienceKeywords.description: Controlled Science Keywords describing the measurements/variables.  The controlled vocabulary for Science Keywords is maintained in the Keyword Management System (KMS).

___ValidRanges.description: Valid ranges of variable data values.

___Offset.description: The factor to which the cell value has been added. The cell value is the value given to a specific location within an array of data values. An example of an offset is '0.49'.

___Scale.description: The factor by which the cell value has been multiplied. The cell value is the value given to a specific location within an array of data values. An example of a scale factor is '0.002'

___VariableType.description: Specify basic type of a variable. These types can be either: Science, Ancillary, Quality etc.

___Measurements.description: The measurement information of a variable.

___Sets.description: The set information of a variable. The variable is grouped within a set. The set is defined by the name, type, size and index. For example, Name: 'Data_Fields', Type: 'General', Size: '15', Index: '7' for the case of the variable named 'LST_Day_1km'.

___FillValues.description: The fill value of the variable in the data file. It is generally a value which falls outside the valid range. For example, if the valid range is '0, 360', the fill value may be '-1'. The fill value type is data provider-defined. For example, 'Out of Valid Range'.

___collections.description: The collections associated with the variable.

$eref.description: CMR level metadata about the item found. This represents data not found in the actual metadata.

___native-id.description: The id used by the provider to identify this item during ingest.

___provider-id.description: The identity of the provider in the CMR

___format.description: The mime type of the original metadata

___revision-id.description: A number >= 1 that indicates which revision of the item.

___deleted.description: Indicates if the item represents a tombstone

___user-id.description: The id of the user who created this item revision.

___revision-date.description: The date this revision was created. This would be the creation or update date of the item in the CMR.

___concept-id.description: The concept id of the item found.

___collections.description: The collections associated with the variable.

___revision-id.description: A number >= 1 that indicates which revision of the item.

___concept-id.description: The concept id of the item found.

___hits.description: The total number of items that matched the search.

___items.description: The list of items matching the result in this page.

$eref.description: Represents a single item found in search results. It contains some metadata about the item found along with the UMM representing the item. umm won't be present if the item represents a tombstone.

___took.description: How long the search took in milliseconds from the time the CMR received the request until it had generated the response. This does not include network traffic time to send the request or return the response.
